document_data.mainbody:
'''The City of Splendors: A Waterdeep Novel''' by [[Ed Greenwood]] and [[Elaine Cunningham]] is the fourth and final book in [[The Cities series]].

{{quote|''In the streets of [[Waterdeep]], conspiracies run like water through the gutters, bubbling beneath the seeming calm of the city's life. As a band of young, foppish lords discovers there is a dark side to the city they all love, a sinister mage and his son seek to create perverted creatures to further their twisted ends.''

''And across it sprawls the great city itself: brawling, drinking, laughing, living life to the fullest.''

''Even in the face of death.''}}
document_data.Synopsis: The novel opens on 30 Ches in the Year of the Tankard (1370 DR) with the ocean-side siege of Waterdeep by the saughrim.{{sectstub}}
